title: Heavy showers above 100mm expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says rainy condition is expected to enhance over Northern, North-central, Eastern,Uva and Central provinces from today (18 ).

title: Israeli cabinet approves Gaza ceasefire accord, due to take effect Sunday
byline: Israel’s cabinet approved a deal with Palestinian militant group Hamas for a ceasefire and release of hostages in the Gaza Strip, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s office said on Saturday, a day ahead of the agreement’s scheduled start.

title: Mother arrested over alleged murder of 10-month-old infant in Palugaswewa
byline: A 10-month-old infant was reportedly found dead at a residence in the Palugaswewa area of the Habarana Police Division.

title: Ex-President Gotabaya leaves CID after recording statement
byline: Former President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has left the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), a short while ago, after providing a statement.

title: Railways GM deems viral video of massage therapy for tourists on train as ‘very insulting’
byline: The General Manager of Sri Lanka Railways J.I.D. Jayasundara described the recent video widely circulating on social media—showing a group of locals performing massage therapy for foreign tourists on a train—as “very insulting”.

title: Electricity tariffs reduce by 20%
byline: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) has decided to reduce electricity tariffs by an average amount of 20% overall, the PUCSL’s Director of Communications Jayanath Herath announced today (17).

title: Sri Lanka to strengthen ties with China’s leading economic hub, Sichuan Province
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, who is currently on a four-day state visit to China, has met with Wang Xiaohui, the Secretary of the Communist Party of China for Sichuan Province, this morning (17).

title: Two arrested with firearms including T56 rifle and ammunition
byline: Police officers have arrested two suspects along with two firearms including a T-56 rifle and more than 60 rounds of live ammunition from a residence in the Wewahamanduwa area in Matara.

title: Electricity tariff revision after Finance Ministry’s advice - CEB
byline: The Ministry of Energy has issued a special announcement regarding the revision of electricity tariffs recommended by the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) today.

title: Israeli security cabinet recommends Gaza ceasefire deal
byline: The Israeli security cabinet has recommended approving the Gaza ceasefire and hostage return deal, ahead of a full cabinet meeting expected later on Friday, a statement from the prime minister’s office said.

title: PNB finds over Rs. 280 million cash in landmark drug money seizure
byline: The Police Narcotics Bureau (PNB) has seized Rs. 283 million in currency notes, marking the largest amount of cash ever confiscated from a drug trafficker in Sri Lanka.

title: President Dissanayake returns after concluding state visit to China
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has arrived in the island, a short while ago, following the conclusion of his four-day state visit to China.

title: US supreme court issues ruling upholding nationwide ban on TikTok
byline: The Supreme Court on Friday unanimously upheld the federal law banning TikTok beginning Sunday unless it’s sold by its China-based parent company, holding that the risk to national security posed by its ties to China overcomes concerns about limiting speech by the app or its 170 million users in the United States.

title: Suspect arrested with T-56 rifle and ammunition in Welikanda
byline: A 53-year-old suspect has been arrested in the Ruhunuketha area of Welikanda with a T-56 Mark 1 assault rifle, a magazine case, and 18 live rounds of ammunition (7.62 x 39mm), suspected to belong to the Army.
